description:
For as long as I could remember, my family has been coming to this restaurant. I remember as a kid I would come here in the early morning hours, slugging along my Father's side. He worked really early and would take me along, the plus side was I could order as much donut holes as physically possible.

Some of my favorite memories are in this restaurant. Walking in to see my uncles, and uncles uncles' and other relatives sitting along the back. Sharing hugs and getting money from each of my family members, I would walk out with a cool $20 in dolla dolla bills ya'll! 

It's a quaint diner, simple food for the neighboring working class residents. It's family owned, supported by the neighborhoods and now accepting credit cards HEYOOO!! 

This is a staple, not only in my neighborhood but in my family. My family, from all over the Bay Area, comes by just to grab a quick bite to eat. I'm sure it's more for nostalgia, but I'll never give this place up.
author: Mileti A.

description:
I've been here before many times. Off/on since 1979. One of my favorite greasy spoon establishments! Burgers,  grilled cheese & breakfasts are traditional and great! Prices are very reasonable. 
They also have donuts and coffee if that's what you only want. That's cool  too.
At this writing, I was on this street looking for something for take out. There are alot of eateries on this street. Couldn't decide. So I went with this place. A for sure place I'm familiar with. Another big plus is that they're open really freaking early for the working folks. Other eateries seem to cater to other folks at 8am! Snap! Morning's half over!
I'm here now. It's 5pm. Place is full! Grill is very busy! Alot of chatter in here. That's a tell tale sign. Lastly the staff always cordial with a smile! That's the kicker. 
So if you're in the area. Come on down!
author: Ray M.

description:
$1 for a sugar donut and $1 for a cinnamon crumb donut!

That's budget-friendly right?...

I don't purchase many donuts because not many have my sugar donut lol

Automatic win for me

I'll be back to check out some more items!
author: Yeanne L.

description:
OMG!  I absolutely love these donuts!  Fresh donuts every day.   They taste sooooo good.  I'm not sure what separates them from the rest.  

I usually buy a dozen and 6 pack donut holes.  No...the dozen isn't for just me!!  I share them!  Except for the donut holes!  They're all mine!  They taste like air!  I don't feel one bit guilty popping those suckers in my mouth one after the other.  My second favorite is their buttermilk bar.  It reminds me of my Grandfather.  Breaks apart, nice a fluffy!

I've also had a BLT there for lunch.  It was your typical homemade BLT.  Tasted great with crunchy bacon and ripe red tomatoes.

It's always packed so I usually grab food and go.  It's small with only a handful of tables available.  It appears they have some regulars on a daily basis.  I'm not referring to myself either!  Lol!

Next time your in Daly City check them out!!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
This place stands out on a street predominantly filled with Chinese and Vietnamese restaurants. The name of the restaurant sounds Western, but I think it's owned by Asians (at least all the staff are Asian and their photos are featured at the front counter). I'm personally a fan and have come here multiple times for breakfast. It's hard for me to pinpoint exactly why I like this place so much because while the food is great, it isn't outstanding and normally I rate my restaurants primarily on their food. It must be the case that I love the atmosphere here and listening to the staff make small talk with the loyal crowd of returning customers.

What I liked:
* Very filling and tasty breakfast combos. They cook it for you fresh.
* Fair prices for the quantity of food you get, though I think it is cash-only.
* Very friendly staff and generally warm atmosphere. A lot of the customers are returning customers and the staff seems to know them well.

What I disliked:
* The donut I had was a bit too sweet? Honestly, there isn't anything solid that I dislike about this place.
author: Michael M.

description: Love J Georgie's.  Friend of mine showed me the place and ever since then I've been a big fan.  Great mom and pop shop and they have the best donut holes or chocolate sprinkles anywhere.  The texture of their glazed donuts and donuts in general (old fashion or not) are all A1.  Highly recommend! Awesome burgers also.
author: Alex C.

description:
I've known of this donut and lunch spot since arriving in the neighborhood a couple of months ago, and have been very curious. My first caveat is that I don't have a sweet tooth, and just the thought of Krispy Kreme donuts sends me into insulin shock... 

But, I was hankering for an old fashioned burger--so armed with some greenbacks (cash only), I dropped into this old school dive and ordered a double cheeseburger with fries. The very cheerful and patient lady behind the counter asked if I wanted everything on it. I did. Then she asked if I would mind accepting a previously made order identical to mine that was still hot, but the to-go customer had not arrived yet and she was concerned they might no-show. 

I accepted the order since I was ravenous, I picked up a chocolate covered cake donut for dessert (shocking, I know--it's for review purposes only... ;). 

The fries were warm, squishy but not soggy. And they tasted great with my concoction of ketchup and hotsauce. The burger was hefty--great sign! The patties were a bit thicker than I had hoped, and the cheese cap leered at me as it oozed down the face of the burger. The patties were seasoned simply and were juicy! The lettuce had crunch, onions were sweet and snappy. The pickles crisp and the tomatoes, flavorful. The buns had been toasted lightly.

The cake donut was not as dense as the ones I am used to, and had a strong vanilla scent to them. They were not bad, just not what I was expecting. 

When it was time to leave, I returned the to-go condiments I did not need or use in the bag to the lady--who had been chattering in a foreign language to the male cook. I asked if they were Thai--turns out they are Cambodian! So I rolled off my best "Chomreab Suor" at them with palms pressed together and fingertips on my chin in respect.

After complimenting them on their food, I thanked them in Cambodian "AwKhoon" and ambled out with a full belly and a broad grin having dropped barely $8+ for a satisfying lunch.
author: Lu-Shien T.

description:
I just love their hamburger and fries and fast good service and it's close to where I live.
Come check it out yourself
author: Lorie Anne B.

description:
Arrived with a party of 4 people. Upon arrival We ordered immediatly with cashier. We ordered mouth watery fresh Big fat donuts. Great burger with pickles, loved the big fat slices of bacon + cheese croissant 
breakfast sandwich.  Highly recommend the ham and cheese omelet for breakfast too.
I also noticed They are not shy about the portions. My party of my best peeps were all satisfied with the fast friendly service and enjoyable well served dishes.
The rumors I read on yelp from other proactive yelpers are all true! 

Only CASH!
Otherwise it's a real casual mom + pops kind of place back to basics were you can see the kitchen and everything is fresh. 

I will be for sure returning
author: Laura N.

description: I made the mistake of ordering some French toast early in the morning here. The French toast was probably cooked on a dirty pan, because it tasted more like chili than egg. The place was also small and dirty. If you want a good place to eat on an early morning I would suggest looking elsewhere.
author: Efrain H.

description: Me and my girlfriend come here often,the food never disappoints !Always hot and fresh off the griddle. Just a neighborhood spot with a melting pot of locals. Staff is always friendly and service comes with a smile ! Fluffy pancakes.. a must try!
author: Darryl B.

description: Small diner-like restaurant, friendly cashier. Cash only. My kids loved the donuts get there early though - donuts are sold out by afternoon.
author: Eliz S.

description: Still go here once a week and get an egg sandwich, a coffee, and a donut. Service is fast and the owners are great people. J Georgie's has become part of my weekend routine.
author: Connor R.

description: I expected more out of this place, Unfortunately the food wasn't good. But the owners were very friendly.
author: Aldo Y.

description: BEST donuts, good burgers... nice friendly service... they remember returning customers and their orders... cinnamon twist and buttermilk are the 2 donuts I strongly suggest... but they sell out fast so go by lunchtime if you want a donut.
author: SMarie V.

description:
Great donuts but after taste like oil...
Quick fix for sweets but heard their burgers are good. Seems too fattening with oil dripping..no thanks. Otherwise great donuts to satisfy a sweet tooth.
author: Meishi M.

description:
I've been to this place many times simply looking for a good glazed donut and some coffee to wake up, but never knew they sold breakfast plates. This morning I came in expecting to get a coffee, but instead order bacon and eggs.  

The prices are very reasonable, the bacon plate was only about $8. They serve generous portions of hash browns into pieces of sliced toast with jelly, just like old times at a diner. I will definitely come back and try more breakfast plates, and give the donuts some love.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Georgie's is my go to.

Donuts, burgers n fries? Now they have breakfast?!?!? I'm so in on that.

I've been a regular at Georgie's since they still had keno on the tv and they only sold donuts n hamburgers.

The couple that run it, they know what's up. There was a breakfast place across the street that dominated the market... It's changed owners and the locals are unhappy... So they now serve brekkie! Way to make the changes needed to bring in all new business! 

I'll see you again soon Georgie :-) me and my Nonna!
author: Melzie C.

description: You don't leave a review for Jim George's you pay homage to this community landmark. I have vivid memories of coming here as a child to get a donut and milk with my father transcending to going by myself to order donut holes and a coffee. The freshness, high standard of quality donuts and coffee still holds true. When I order food I usually get a hamburger with jalapeños or a breakfast burger (adding an egg). Perfectly grilled like it's cooked out of your family member's kitchen. This type of restaurant has stood the test of time and now we should all rejoice in it's greatness as a breakfast / burger joint in the new age of technology & bring cash!
author: Rubin S.

description: Love this place. Good, cheap food and nice staff. Used to be the spot I got my breakfast back in HS and I am glad they are still in business - with all the changes going on in the city it seems like most of the places I used to go to are closing shop so I am hoping Jim Georgie's Donuts is here to stay forever.  I recommend the donut holes with chocolate on top and the cheeseburger and hash brown. So good!
author: Niko B.

description: I came here after a disappointment at Nation's at Westlake, and this place blows them away simply with great friendly service, good food. I'll always come here.
author: wayz W.

description: I have lived near this location for a really long time but never bothered on trying it until last week. I got a sausage omelette with a hash brown and side of toast ($8.45). The portions are fairly big but definitely not overwhelming. Everything was cooked amazingly and the service was extremely nice. They are really packed in the mornings so dining arrangements are a little difficult but other than that, I think this is my new go to breakfast spot.
author: Crystal D.

description: The pancakes here will give you liiiiiifeee ! They are super fluffy, buttery and just hella good ! They are better than most pancakes I've had. They may not be good for the waistline but they suit my tummy just fine ! Oh parking here is a hassle and they only take take cash, enjoy !
author: Aniah S.

description: I love this place.  I started but there mini burger since I was in high.  Great price and good service. Best price for breakfast and donuts .
author: sean c.

description: Love this place. It's small, but the food is cheap and goooooood. The employees are super friendly and nice- it had been around a year since I had last went there, and when I visited 2 weeks ago, he instantly remembered me and what I use to order! Grew up going to this place for some bomb donuts and burgers, and will be coming again soon!
author: Jessica L.

description: $1 dollar donuts, yes!!! Today, I needed some coffee and decided donuts would go well with it, so I yelped donuts, and ended up here. I came with two friends, and we bought 2 donuts, 2 small coffees, and a philly cheese steak with fries (around $7), all for $12! Service was great, and the huge chocolate donut filled me up. We were all happy campers, and I'd come back.
author: Corinna T.

description:
Whoa, this place about to spike up someone's blood pressure. 

Located in San Bruno where I deemed a mini-Chinatown, this place is an Chinese owned but has American food. I ordered a tuna melt. It was very greasy (my hands reeked of butter afterwards but not in a good way), and ratio of tuna to cheese was off. Too much cheese, not enough tuna. The only function it served was to fill me up after my morning shift but I drank 2 cups of water along the way. Sorry California's drought, but you gotta do what you gotta do. My friend got a ham + croissant sandwich and she threw away most of it at the end because it was way too salty (especially the ham). Salty food makes us salty. 

Two stars because I haven't tried everything and service was very friendly. Maybe one day if I ever get over how greasy it smells and feels, I'll go in to try their breakfast menu.
author: Minh L.

description:
Doesn't look like much from the outside (or the inside for that matter), but the staff are always friendly and they get you good food very fast. The best thing is the prices, donuts for $1 and coffee for a couple bucks. They also have a big variety of things from burgers to breakfast plates.

One important note: This place is cash only. There's an ATM down San Bruno at the Walgreens if you find your wallet light.
author: Jesse C.

description: Hot spot for Portola locals. I don't even like donuts but the crueller is amazing! I'm a huge fan.
author: Linda L.

description: I absolutely love this place ! I have. Been going to this place since I was a little girl ! Everything taste so fresh , from the donuts to the burgers ! .. also everyone is super friendly !
author: Kristina A.

description:
Still one of my favorite donut shops to get a donut when I am hungry. I came in today and tried one of the breakfast items from their menu. I ordered the hash browns when I came for breakfast. Cheeseburger and french fries tastes good so I am definitely coming back. Good service and friendly staff!

Edit for 07/19/2014:
Here are the current hours of operation:
Monday - Friday 5:00 am - 6:00 pm
Saturday 6:00 am - 4:00 pm
Sunday 6:00 am - 12:00 pm
author: Bennett W.

description: Good quick spot for coffee and your standard donuts..  a bit pricey for simple breakfast and lunch items, nothing really special about it.. gotta keep up w san fran lease rent.  It's kind of a dingy little spot, cash only southeast asian owned mom and pop spot.   worthwhile to stop for a quick snack.. parking is a pain in the rear, double park and grab something to go.
author: Pedro N.

description:
Admittedly, I am a fried carbohydrate whore. 

Now that this is out in the open, I can tell you this place is great. Old school, everything out on display, everything fresh, and everything is huge! No specialty that I could see from the quick once over I did but a cinnamon twist lasted me pretty much the entire ride down to Monterey from San Francisco so...they're size-able pillows of fried dough.

Everything was fresh, fresh, fresh. People were nice, FAST, and efficient. They obviously have been in business for a while and know what they're doing. 

Definitely stop by. We did because I needed change for the meters but they have a lovely old-fashioned set-up. I could see this place looking the exact same way 10 years ago and on some level, that charm just isn't reproducible nowadays.
author: Jennyfer N.

description:
Everything about this place is charming. People of all ages flock in here bright and early for their usual. Me? I love my glazed donuts and a fried egg sandwich. Also, one of the very few places in San Francisco with a cup of coffee for under $2. 

Everyone is so nice behind the counter and they remember you. Sometimes they'll see you in line and have your order ready before you get to the counter.  What's not to love, honestly? Stop by, grab a donut, sit down and people watch. You'll see what I'm talking about.
author: Dee D.

description: I've only tried the donuts here, and I've enjoyed them every time. They're cheap, fresh, and delicious... What's not to like? Staff is super friendly too.
author: Diana G.

description:
I spent $4.25 for a six-pack of doughnuts. And these doughnuts are fluffy and "Bomb-Diggity!"

Okay, who wants some?
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vVuPM8g9SA9m-iIOM_93dA?select=3scfa1fccI375tuctOe8Mg

Sike... Go get your own six-pack!
author: Matt G.

description: I always take a long walk and stop by this place for a mini burger and fries. the people are nice and the service is fast! Just wish they had an online menu for order pick up!
author: FoodieBy T.

description: Ok so I'm updating my review. Good continues to be great at great price. I love that you can get just about anything from the menu as long as they're open. Breakfast is delicious, donuts are fresh and the coffee continues to be simple, rich, delicious coffee. Hands down the BEST burger for who knows how big of an area in the city. Either the bacon cheeseburger or mushroom cheeseburger it try both for a real treat. A fried egg would be awesome but you'd need a third hand to hold it all together. I know it's a small family joint but I do wish this place was open late. And the parking... so glad I can get my cheeseburger fix at 5:30 am. Lol
author: Main M.

description: Friendly AMAZING STAFF, delicious doughnuts and even better breakfast. Me and my boyfriends go to Saturday breakfast from now on. For under 25$ we left stuffed forget about spending twice that across the street. Great job guys!
author: Sandra G.

description:
Best doughnut holes holes in the San Francisco Bay Area.  And only $2 for a dozen!  This place is the best.  Parking is a little tight there, but well worth a trip.  Grab a couple of bags of doughnut holes the next time you are on your way to SFO.

Friendly and quick service.  Lots of morning regulars with a good vibe here.  This is a true San Bruno Ave gem.
author: Terry T.

description: Affordable and delicious burger and fries here. Place was jammed and for good reason. Folks working were also very nice.
author: Chad O.

description: This place is near my house, which is exceptionally okay, the food is good considering the prices. Nothing special about them and the male cashier is rude.
author: Karen G.

description:
Have been coming here for about 10+ yrs.

 Employees are always friendly, and service is pretty quick! they serve breakfast, burgers, donuts, e.t.c... So far everything my kids and I have eaten there is good! Only complaint I do have is coffee is very watery it does nothing for me, tastes like tea and they don't take atm cards! Just Make sure you have cash, or go across the street to the atm: and if you want to sit down to eat, very early in the mornings are packed,
author: Susie C.

description: love this place..have been coming here every morning for the past 19 yrs..prices are decent food is good fresh coffee and the owners are very friendly..
author: Sol H.

description:
Love this place! 

I come here for breakfast and lunch sometimes. I love their donuts and Philly Cheesesteak Sandwiches! Their Philly Cheesesteak is filled with meat, bell peppers, some onions, and lots of cheese.
author: Joyce G.

description:
Dear Yelp, you let me down again by averaging 55 reviews to 4.5 out of 5 stars for Jim Georgie's Donuts, making this the top rated place in San Francisco for donuts...?!  Someone even said the apple fritters here were better than Bob's Donuts!  While the fritters weren't horrible, it tasted like the frying oil they used was slightly off.  But the texture was balanced, crispy and chewy.  They also can't warm up the donuts for you since they 'don't have a microwave'.  

I understand neighborhood pride of their local shops but this is ridonkulous.  And I'm not surprised people who don't have to come here, wouldn't.  WTF Yelp?  How is this the best donut place in SF?  I think we need to take a break, it's not you, it's me... not being able to trust you.
author: kiwi l.

description:
If you are looking for a good burger, you'll find it here! Your food is made by order so you know it is fresh but it's worth the wait. The price of each burger includes fries and they always ask whether you would like everything (onions, mayo, pickles, etc..) in it. The doughnut holes are $1 for 6. They are absolutely delicious. I have been buying doughnut holes from J. Georgie's ever since I was in elementary school and their quality and fair prices have not changed. 

Whenever I go to the bathroom in the back, the kitchen is always vacant and empty. It seems like no one uses the back and hasn't been cleaned in a while. The tables are usually clean but occasionally it will be sticky. Hopefully, sometime soon, they will remodel!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Very Charming/Nice people behind the counter. Had a cheese burger with fires and some donut holes... 6 holes for a $1! :)   

Burger was tasty and straight forward. They did not put salt on the fries, which I liked. Burger was a bit small for my liking and they didn't give me much fries.
I recommend ordering the Double patty and eating their in hopes of more fries! 

I also say a special for 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, and 2 links or sausages for $5.55! Going to try that next time and report back! 

As a child, I remember  that business's would be like this. Cash only and using a brown board with white letters to display the menu.
author: Alfonso C.

description: These donuts melt in your mouth. We love every single donut they have. You can't beat a mixed dozen for exactly $10!!
author: Chase L.

description:
Hubs and I were sharing a car our last week in SF, so we decided to have a breakfast date one morning before he dropped me off at work.  Since I work in bayview, I was a little hesitant we'd find something we'd enjoy....enter Jim Georgie's.  My gosh, so good!  so cheap!  so nice!  so old school!  I had the reg breakfast, we both got a cappuccino, and I also got half a dozen donut holes to go...for like $1 or something cheap. 

Definitely a fan!
author: Amber E.

description:
One of my favorite places to get my burger and fries fix or grab doughnut holes. Used to come here in my pre-undergraduate days as a kid and it would always be a great time with me and my friends when we were growing up together. 

Cheeseburger and fries were always so consistent --- fries were always so hot right when it was being served, being a stubborn kid, holding the fries and feeling the hotness on my fingers, then transferring it to my mouth was me being naive as I've burned my pallet and tongue a few times like this. I would have to cool off the fries with some ketchup and the fries would always be salted the right amount; not too salty either! The cheeseburger here is made on their grill that you can see yourself and you can just smell the great aroma when you walk by the restaurant. Lettuce, tomatoes, onions were always fresh whenever you ordered the cheeseburger here, yes, the cheeseburger and fries were always one of my favorites at J. Georgie's. 

My ultimate favorite thing at J. Georgie's were their doughtnut holes! They're absolutely fantastic and if you have yet to try their doughnut holes when they're fresh, then you're missing out on way too much! Unfortunately as time progresses, so do prices and the amount you get. I would still say the price of doughnut holes for their rate is still fair in this struggling economy we have here. I would have to say it is still very worth the money you pay. 

This is a great local restaurant in the Portola district, as many regulars do come here at up and early in the morning to get their breakfast and coffee.
author: Sam K.

description:
My neighborhood donut shop is always reliable in providing me with big, fresh donuts (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vVuPM8g9SA9m-iIOM_93dA?select=5fyh60u-QtJxTDAVI_hKRA) whenever I want them.  I've been enjoying J. Georgie's Donuts since the 70's.  That's right ... nearly forty years, and I'm certain this place had been here a lot longer than I've been in the neighborhood.

J. Georgie's gets really busy in the morning and afternoon hours with a steady flow of customers, mostly regulars ranging in age from young to old.  The interior hasn't changed since I first started going there for an after school snack decades ago.  The junior high school I attended was just two blocks away, and this was always a friendly place for an inexpensive snack.  There are about a half dozen long communal tables inside (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vVuPM8g9SA9m-iIOM_93dA?select=6IdfM4A9f-3JPJpbjsDiIA) and everybody sits together.  I order food to eat in often because I find it's a great way to meet my neighbors and many of the folks who work in our neighborhood.  Neighborhood gossip fuels many of the conversations inside, and it's often fun and always interesting.

The Asian family that runs the restaurant is super nice.  In addition to offering fresh brewed coffee and tea and a window full of fresh donuts J. Georgie's serves up all day breakfasts and huge burgers that won't hurt your wallet.  Check out their double hamburger (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vVuPM8g9SA9m-iIOM_93dA?select=ypgLL-SD7J8vQDy6wFBVWA).  That's two quarter pound beef patties fried up on the same griddle that they use to fry up bacon and served on an oversized bun with mayo, shredded lettuce, a slice of onion, a thick slice of tomato and pickle chips.  The huge burger comes with a large order of meaty fries all for a measly $5.40.  The burgers are a bit on the greasy side, but if you eat them slowly often you can taste some of that bacon fat taste mixed in with the beefy taste.  So good!

Because I get out from work around midnight on most weekdays I've often walked past this restaurant in the middle of the night.  The lights in the back of the restaurant are usually on, and I can smell the aroma of the fresh donuts being fried up in the back.  Most of their donuts are in the 80 cents range but they do make donut holes also and those cost much less.  They carry canned sodas, bottled juices, Berkeley Farms dairy products and an assortment of flavors of Jarritos in their refrigerated unit.  Cash only.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
The burgers and fries here are just DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!!

and so are the donuts

that's all I gotta say. Little restaurant, great food, great location, great vibe. Been going since middle school.
author: Benjamin W.

description:
Holy Doughnuts?! The prices here are so cheap, I feel like I'm back in the 90's.  Seriously, you can pick up a whole breakfast for under $5.00.  I felt obligated to share my find with you yelpers, since I know you like food and all.

Although Doughnuts are Georgie's specialty, I'm a fan of the egg sandwiches. They are simple enough - egg, tomato and cheese, for only $2.25 each. I was here last weekend, purchase two large coffees, two egg sandwiches and a doughnut for under $9.00. It's not your fancy pants coffee, but it's pretty good and does the job.

I love the crumb cake doughnuts here, they are crummy - in a good way.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
My favorite coffee stop on San Bruno St. just happens to also still doughnuts. If you remember anything about San Bruno St. it's probably going to be J. Georgie's cafe here. It's been around for quite a while.

During the early morning rush, this place can be packed with people enjoying their breakfast and newspaper so if you have the time, grab your breakfast here to go and enjoy it around the park it the recreation center a few blocks away.

The coffee here is great compared to other locations around this street, but their doughnuts can be a hit and miss. They're a bit too hard for my taste. As for the breakfast, it's alright. I ordered the steak and eggs plate and the steak turned out to only be about a quarter of an inch thick. Bummer...
author: George Z.

description: Delicious French toast! Great service with reasonable and affordable menu :) amazing way to start your day!
author: Zion S.

description: Simple good burgers. I tried the mushroom burger with fries combo, turned out moist and delicious. I also enjoy that they toast their buns. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Will come back to try their breakfast meals and donuts!
author: Melissa P.

description:
I should add right up front thatt this place is NOT just a donut place. It's a diner.

J Georgie's is a Portola district classic, for sure. It's hard to explain why I love it - the place is pretty beat down, you order your own food (no service) and it's cramped. But there's something strangely nostalgic and comforting about it - and not just because they serve mostly "comfort" food. Come here with no expectations other than walking out a full belly and a full wallet.

Eating here brings me back to my high school days. If I only had a few dollars I would take myself to J Georgie's and split some fries with a friend for $1.50 or get a few glazed donuts with a chocolate milk. Nowadays I come here for breakfast sandwiches or clubs, which are wholesome and delicious. It's the type of place where you could sit for hours and no one looks at you funny or makes you feel like you haven't ordered enough food to justify the seat you're taking. It's welcoming, in a hole-in-the-wall type of way.

As long as I can remember, there has been a group of old men who get together here every day. Just goes to show, this is the type of place with a lot of regulars, whic hspeaks volumes about the place. I could honestly say that San Bruno Ave would not be the same without them - I hope they stay around for a long time.
author: Mariela D.

description: This was my first time here and let me say, well done good sir!!  Friendly service, cheap food and good food. The donuts are large and and packed with yummy-ness.  I also got a fried egg sandwich. It is made with plain cheap bread, egg, tomato and lettuce. Add cheese if you want or meat.  All for a low price of $4.85. Or somewhere in that range.  I really enjoys this little place and it will stay bookmarked for future visits.
author: Sean B.

description:
Love this place so much! The environment here is very friendly! The cashier is awesome and sweet(plus he remembers your name). I stumbled upon this place looking for good to eat! I was really surprised when I found this place! Love their double cheese burger with fries for about $8! Would totally recommend this place! Also their pancakes with scrambled eggs with bacon on point!! 
Checklist:
Employees are very friendly(check)
Food is delicious(check)
Food is fresh(check)
Food is affordable for a student(check)
Tables are clean*most of the time*(check) 
Great place to chat(check)
Supplies condiments(check)
Customers are happy(check)
Here take my 5 star rating!!!! :)
author: Manh N.

description:
I seriously wish there was a J. Georgie's in every neighborhood in San Fran.

Cheap, scrumptious donuts. Donuts are my favorite dessert if you consider donuts a dessert-- get a dozen! Will last you all week!

I've had many bacon burgers, and this place makes the best one I've ever had. 

More J. Georgie's please!
author: Jennifer A.

description: Not a bad burger, salty and juicy like I love it. Party's aren't really made to cook to temperature (medium rare).... But a good hot burger and fries none the less. Clean little dining room with lots of donuts. Really awesome, gigantic donuts. Not a bad place at all
author: John B.

description: Awesome donut holes just 2 bucks a dozen. Great hash browns. I had all sorts of random requests, like, cut up an apple fritter into 8 pieces, and he didn't blink. Very friendly
author: Martin R.

description:
Great breakfast any hour. The staff works hard and makes great food at cheap prices.

If you're fond of wholesome, old-school greasy spoons, you'll feel right at home.
author: Bitty B.

description:
This is a take on your old school classic donut shop. Donuts are simple, fresh, and delicious. Not like other larger chain donut shops. 

You'll find some retired old guy with glasses in the corner reading the daily newspaper, drinking coffee, and having the same donut everyday. 

The owner is some super nice asian lady. I'd definitely come back here again.
author: Jimmy W.

description:
I used to pass this a lot before and always see construction workers on weekdays eating breakfast here. I finally got to enter when my husband was craving a donut. From my first visit, I noticed that it looked quite gloomy because it appeared with little lighting inside where the tables were, along with its old and un- updated interior. Anyways, their donuts were good. 

On Labour day, my hubby decided we try having breakfast here as its nearby. Hubby ordered a breakfast combo that consisted of sausages, eggs, toast, and hash browns. I bought myself a regular coffee. It was a very simple and easy to make kind-of breakfast but I appreciated it because it gave me that "out of town" and road trip feel which I find heart- warming. There's something about those cheap, and convenient breakfast joints when you don't feel like preparing at home. Surprisingly, the regular coffee tasted good too for such a cheap price that you can refill.  I also realized that they can turn on the lights in the dining area and no longer felt gloomy. However, my suggestion to the owners with be to at least make some little interior updates to create a brighter and clean atmosphere. I hope they pretty-up this place.
author: Erika K.

description: I've been coming here since I was a little kid. Started off only getting donuts here because I didn't realize that they served actual food here since every time I went in, people were only eating donuts and drinking coffee. It wasn't until high school when I realized that they served breakfast and lunch here! Get their bacon cheese burger and/or chili cheese fries. TOO GOOD! Staff is very friendly too (but maybe it's because I feel like I grew up with them haha). Also superfast at cooking the food, I always get it too go and never waited long.
author: Lina C.

description:
Simply put, this is the place where local San Franciscans, that reside in the Portola-Silver Terrace areas go to on their way to work.  Decent breakfast, hot coffee, and doughnuts are the main menu fare.  There are also burgers and other flat-topped items.  

I have not been in a while for breakfast, but it is one of the few places that have kept their sign and menu in an ever changing neighborhood. I have stopped for coffee and a doughnut when I am up that early and my waist can afford it.  (Who am I kidding?  Screw my waist!)

The doughnuts are always fresh. I attribute that to the quick turn around and the steady traffic in the mornings.

The only downside to this place is that they do not have a parking lot and due to bus stops and parking restrictions it is still sometimes hard to find a place to park.

By observation, I watch most locals take the risk of running in and out, grabbing their wares, and hoping that a parking attendant has not placed a ticket on their vehicles by the time they have come back out.
author: Joshua C.

description:
I used to love donuts when I was a kid. I would look forward to getting one from Safeway whenever I went grocery shopping with my mom. And then in high school, I remember trying Krispy Kreme for the first time and it felt like a literal orgasm in my mouth or a slice of heaven. Since then, I don't know what's happened but I've had a falling out with donuts. When I eat Krispy Kreme now, it's just a donut to me. I don't like it but I don't hate it, but considering how unhealthy it is, I'm glad I don't care much for it. 

Based on these reviews, I was hoping I would get that childhood Krispy Kreme experience when I bit into my donut but alas it was just a donut. I did like it slightly better than Krispy Kreme though because it wasn't throw it in my face sweet. And I do appreciate the fact that this place makes their own donuts. Not many places do that anymore. 

I also had the omelette and an orange juice. For some reason, I was expecting the OJ to be fresh squeezed. Technically it was, but it was prepackaged. No biggie, just mentioning it as a detail for you readers. As for the omelette, it was very filling and the condiments (tomatoes and whatnot) were very tasty. I didn't have high expectations for this either but just noting that the omelette isn't shaped like an actual omelette. It comes with bread and hash browns. Make sure to tell them you don't want your bread buttered if you're lactose-intolerant or just don't like butter on your bread. As for the hash browns, they're pretty flavorless but that's where ketchup comes in. 

Lastly, we were sitting at the second to last table at the back of the store and I could smell the odors from the bathroom. That was quite unpleasant so I'd suggest sitting closer to the front of the store. One table distance really makes a difference.

I wouldn't mind coming back to this place if someone else wants to but I would definitely never ask to come here myself.
author: Karen C.

description: Amazing donuts! Honestly the best I've ever had. They are huge too. A little more expensive than other donut places I've been to, but it is always worth it. Bring cash.
author: Natalie V.

description: Not the best in any particular category but the best overall! Neighborhood doughnut shop with staff that show they enjoy what they do or at least don't show they hate it... great doughnuts great burgers great fries!
author: Sam A.

description: The chocolate donuts have a weird after taste. I love donuts, especially chocolate ones, but these are really heavy and they taste different. This place is pretty grimy, but most of the places on this street are pretty sketchy.
author: Jamie B.

description:
DONUTS, DONUTS & DONUTS!!

I absolutely adore and support mom and pops shop especially since they've been here since forever. J Georgies!!

Grew up in the Portola District so my family and I often frequent this spot whenever we're on San Bruno Avenue grocery shopping or doing laundry. 

I can not tell you how addicted I am to their donuts; their chocolate glazed and custard filled donuts get me everytime and the main reason I'm always here. Their grilled cheese is also a favorite for my kiddies. Buttery white bread, with thick and gooey cheese melted to perfection makes this the perfect grilled cheese for my kiddies :)
You can never go wrong with their burgers and fresh fries :)
Don't forget your coffee or hot chocolate.

A tiny spot which tends to fill up quickly bc they're that good so you have plenty of neighborhood friendlies stopping by for their morning cup of joe, breakfast or just to say hello to the owners. 

*Metered street parking so have some change ready 

If you're ever in the neighborhood, please stop by and have a try :)
author: Anonymous P.

description:
Jim Georgie's Donuts can be summed up in one word: Simple.

Their Double Cheese Burger is so simple, yet so delicious. 

Their prices are great! It was only $6.25 for a Double Cheese Burger & fries.

The woman who took our order was very friendly.

We will definitely be back!!
author: Juliette R.

description: Looking for Cheap good food come here!!! Great donuts and breakfast! Lunch is awesome too! Its one of the better food establishments on San Bruno Ave. Friendly neighborhood cafe and the coffee is good too. Come check out this spot if your looking for some grub on San Bruno.
author: J M.

description:
French toast is average. What you would get if you just make it at home with a few slices of white bread (yes, regular white bread. not the thick kind). Nothing to rave about. It's a neighborhood diner. Don't expect much. 

I used to like their donuts but now it tastes a bit plasticy? artificial? I don' know. The glazed donut holes used to be delish here... now, not so much.

Not sure why this place has 4+ stars. Maybe it deserves a 3 star back when the donuts were decent... now it's more like 2 stars. Maybe I should try the burgers. I'll update after trying the burgers.
author: Shirlene K.

description: Doughnuts and food are fine. Only 2 stars because I brought my own coffee mug because I hate to waste paper cups and the lady FORCED me to pour the coffee into the paper cup and then into my mug. Her reason was that my mug was bigger then her large. For the record my mug is 20oz. I get annoyed at the pettiness of this sort of thing. As though the cost of throwing away a perfectly good cup isn't greater then the "free" few ounces of coffee I may have gotten. It speaks to the kind of cash only shop that will give you $0.99 back instead of a dollar. Not my kind of joint. I say pass this spot and go somewhere more inviting and less petty.
author: Terese P.

description: I was just there this morning I had sausage and eggs and a nice cuppa coffee and the place seems to be clean every time I'm there so I would recommend a 20 buddy
author: david b.

description: I have been coming to J Georgie's off and on for over 20 years and one thing is for sure, it has always been good and consistent.  I am huge fan of their double cheese burger, grilled nice and juicy and comes with everything on it.  Who needs gourmet when the down home, real neighborhood style of cooking is so much better... and did I mention easier on the wallet.  Another thing I just tried today was their coffee and like others who have reviewed give that a standing ovation.  If you are in the mood for a great burger or sandwich, this is the place.
author: J P.

description:
Good donut shop, makes the burgers just how you like them. However, their price is a little pricey. Considering that theres a McDonalds just down 6 blocks or so. Great spot to pick up donut holes or some fries. 
However, dont expect it to be cheap.
author: Jared Z.

description:
Awesome little doughnut spot. Never been here for so long, almost forgot about this place. The donuts are a little above average. Doughnuts shops are pretty hard to come by and this place does a great job of keeping the place running. 

They're prices are really cheap for great quality. I think I ate here once, forgot what I got but it was pretty good. I really don't know why I don't come here more often when I pass this place very often.

Try the doughnut holes. They're so worth it :p
author: Hui L.

description:
This is the best doughnut shop i have been to!... Maybe the only doughnut shop i go to... best in the area!

Regardless, this doughnut place is pretty good. This place is own by a Asian family and every morning, they make their donuts fresh!! That is why it is always so packed in the a.m. their donuts are on the cheap side. I am not a big fan of donuts because i always get them for free.. Bucket full  of them..but i still can't resist the doughnut holes here!!  i always get their doughnut holes! The powder sugar ones only though!!! Nothing else!!  Really good! They always run out before the glazed ones.  

Besides the donuts, they make their breakfast fresh, they make all kind of stuff, BLT, ham and cheese, french toast,and more and more. Oh they also make burgers and fries. Their bacon cheeseburger is pretty good and it is only around 3 dollars. Definitely worth a try.
author: Daniel L.

description:
This place was right on the money after reading the reviews on Yelp. 
Cheap and delicious fried egg sandwiches for $2.50 plus real, cake donuts that satisfy the sweet tooth!

A good place to stop before hitting the road and doing some sight-seeing.

Thanks Jim Georgie's!
author: Harpal S.

description: Decent old school doughnuts. I cannot speak to the quality of the other food. I was quite let down by their apple fritter though which is to me a most be good to love a doughnut joint. It did not have the write crisp to doughey ration and seemed like their frier temp most of been low because it was oilier than it needed to be.
author: Audrey N.

description:
So I'm just going to talk about the doughnuts because I always get them here.  I've bought burgers from them before, but donuts are usually the main food items I buy here.

The doughnuts are AMAZING.  I'm not like a food connoisseur or anything, but this doughnut is delicious.  They don't flood you with sweet like Krispy Kreme; they don't overpower you with weird sweet like 7-11; and they're just plain better than all other doughnut places I've tried in San Francisco and Berkeley.

I think it's something about the texture that appeals to me.  They're not dry, they're not too hard/firm, and the sweetness is very well balanced.  The glazing isn't like moist either; that's just gross.  These doughnuts are REALLY well made.

I've tried their old-fashioned, sprinkles, glazed, chocolate, sugar-coated, bread-crumbs, doughnut holes, as well as their twists.  I think my favorite is the twist but all their doughnuts are amazing.

I highly recommend the doughnuts here!  And it seems most of the neighborhood also loves their breakfast menu as well.  Great staff, excellent food, very fair prices despite the raise over the years.
author: Filmer Y.

description: Not a great place to eat in, but other than that - fantastic breakfasts, low prices and superb donuts.  This place would give a cardiologist a nervous breakdown, but ohh so good!
author: Ken P.

description: Aside from the oh-so delicious desserts they offer, the burgers are pretty bomb too! I ordered a mini burger ($1.95, no cheese) and fries (forgot the cost) today. Wowza! Can't believe I forgot how good the burgers tasted! The lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, and onions were so crunchy. And the sauce, oh my, very juicy. The french fries were tasty too (I munched on them while I went home. Oh and remember to add the salt or else it'll taste like regular 'ol potatoes). Gotta get another burger again soon!
author: Vicky P.

description: Great donuts, even at 3 in the afternoon. Can't wait to go back and try some fresh cooked breakfast or burgers.
author: James N.

description: Get your local feel here... shooting the breezes over coffees, donuts and teas...
author: Steve G.

description:
I like these little homestyle donut shops like J Georgies! My high school use to be only blocks away, so I'd stop by in the mornings for donuts n donut holes for breakfast back then..

Now that i revisited the place, its still the same!! Good places to go to are those who can keep it consistent with what they have to offer. The donuts are delicious, even better when they are fresh in the morning time. They also serve lunch off the grill like burgers and fries, hot dogs, etc. 

Very homey place, run by Husband and Wife.
author: Helen T.

description:
mmmmm...mmmm...GOOOOOD!

Love the homestyle donuts with chocolate on top. I stop by here every morning on the way to work. 

I brought my cousin here who's from out of town and she was majorly impressed.
author: Rela S.

description: When I was a toddler my family would grocery shop around this area and would always grab a donut and/or burger here. 20 years later it brought back memories when I driving by with my daughter and we had donuts n burgers. It's still yummy. Awwww the memories
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description: This is an old school mom and pop shop. No frills about it. the food is tasty and reasonabe. I've been coming here forever. Love everything about it.
author: Ayana K.

description:
Burgers & the donuts are thee best here. They cook it to my liking (medium-rare burger's) & the fries EXTRA crispy, but still moist inside.

Too bad the place isn't big enough... the morning's get soo busy with all these construction workers.
author: Kimmi Mey S.

description: I come here all the time. Fast, cheap, good, friendly device, and 2 min from my house! Could it get  any better? Always get the burger but decided to try the Philly, delish!
author: Carlie B.

description: Been coming here since I was a kid with my brother and friends everything is still the same which is great since the whole city has changed san Bruno ave is not the same but this little hole in the wall is a diamond In the ruff!!! love the people that work here the cook ( latin lady) is the same one that made my burgers when I was young the restaurant is family owned I believed its the nice that runs it now !! the prices are great and food is better!! just wish parking wasn't hard to find but its the city !! love J Georgie's!!!
author: Monique L.

description: My family has gone here numerous times for donuts but we had yet to stay for their breakfast.  (Which we would have had the burgers everyone on YELP wrote about had we not already ate burgers for lunch yesterday. - Next time for SURE!) The people who work there were super friendly and our food came-out hot and the portions were spot on.  (We both had the basic breakfast with sausage - the sausage was the star.  I couldn't finish mine so my hubby made sure it didn't go to waste!)  It is good solid food and 5 hours later I am still not hungry!  You can tell this is a local favorite as I saw a neighbor enjoying his coffee there and found out he is there quite often.  Then we started to see several regulars and the happy faces on both sides of the counter.  We will be back for sure!
author: Kathleen F.

description: Kim, the lady usually at the cashier, is always so pleasant. The donuts here are fresh and the breakfast items here are all solid. I usually get the breakfast speacial, which includes 2 sausages, 2 bacon, hash brown and eggs sunny side up.  YUMMY!
author: Dee L.

description: This place is one of my childhood favorites and I have many a fond memory of walking along San Bruno Ave. after school and stopping in for a donut or some fries. For full meals I liked to order their chicken sandwich (pretty tasty) and get some fries on the side. A lot of people come in for their donuts and I love their donut holes. Good place overall, albeit a bit dingy inside. They renovated it a few years back so it's not AS bad as it was before.
author: Sannie L.

description:
Donuts are pretty good.
Breakfast cheap and yummy. I dont know how they get the cheese in the omelet to spread so that there's a bit of cheese in each bite.
Its almost open. 26 minutes...
The whole menu is cheap and good. And fast. You can have your food in a few minutes. Which works for me, especially now.  When one hasant slept its easier to feel morning hunger...
author: Cheryl D.

description:
F*** starbucks. Medium coffee (take your 'tall' and 'venti' and stick it where the sun dont shine.) + 4 donut holes = breakfast under $2! Is that even still possible in SF? 

no wonder this place is packed between 6am and 10am
author: Elizabeth F.

description: nothing outstanding, but nothing terrible as well.  A solid burger and the hash browns were good.
author: Ron G.

description: Their burgers are so good!! I always get their mushroom burger with sunny side up egg inside. Hehe I used to go here, before school starts! If you missed breakfast, you should stop by and get those donuts! Oh man, those donuts are delicious! Smells so good..hehe
author: Claireace M.

description: I really enjoy their burgers but I don't like their breakfast. Their hash brown isn't crispy enough and their toast taste weird
author: Shelly W.

description:
So im strolling by And i walk into this little mom and pop donut shop. The 
The experience went like this:
1) walk into a warm coffee and bacon aroma room.
2)lady asks me hi HON ., (as in honey ) what can
I get for you. 
3) order a club sandwich on whole wheat with jalapenos.
4)$6.00 sandwich was in my hands in like 5 minutes with piping hot fries!
5)ate it at at the crowded tables. 
6) got up and told myself..  Coming here again for the pancakes and sausage!
author: jorge d.

description:
First of all, the business name is sort of wrong. It is missing the "& Hamburgers" which is what really caught my eye. 

This place is basically in my neighborhood - well it's within easy walking distance anyway. But I noticed it because it's near a 101 South entrance. And when I would drive to work, it would look at me while I was waiting to turn left on to the freeway. "Donuts and Hamburgers?  That's an interesting combination.  huh!".

Well Saturday morning I woke up early and walked over here and grabbed a donut. It was pretty good, and the place was packed. I figured that was a good sign, and I planned to come back again to try some more food.

Yesterday, Tuesday, I was working from home in the morning like I always do. And when I left at 10am I was hungry. So I decided to go back and try out some of their cooked food. I had french toast and eggs, and you know what? While it wasn't fantastic, it was pretty good. 

This place has a pretty good neighborhood eatery feel, with people reading newspapers on the long tables, and such. The employees are nice and cheerful, the food is decent or better (I've yet to try the lunch food) and the prices are fair. And, oh yes, it is within half a mile form my place. I will be back!

UPDATE:

I went here for lunch today, and the lunch was good, and cheap, and I love, love, the neighborhoody feel of it. It is now 5 stars!
author: neil c.

description:
Sometimes you wake up and you feel just a little sluggish.  It's those mornings that I visit J. Georgie's for an oversized raised doughnut or an apple fritter.  A little extra sugar certainly goes a long in keeping the energy level up throughout the morning.

The Asian family that runs this business is very nice and friendly.  I don't believe the pastries are made on the premises though.
author: Sara A.

description:
Great deal on yummy sandwiches and donuts- the family running the place is wonderful (the entire family pitches in, it's so sweet) and hopefully you're not dieting, because their comfort food hits the spot! 

Their donuts are the freshest i've had and their lunches are a bargain. 

They feature burgers, grilled sandwiches, coffee, donuts, fries, breakfasts... all at a bargain price and with friendly service. 
And mmmm... their donut holes.... soooo goood... I could live on those things! 

If you're in the neighborhood, give it a try! It's a tiny little place, certainly not "romantic" by any means, but a fun  & friendly neighborhood eatery!
author: M'ia K.

description:
A great place to grab some breakfast, a few donuts, and some coffee. My little cousins love to go to this place for a french toast/pancake breakfast. One order of french toast with eggs and sausage is big enough for two 10-yr olds to share. 

Also, the ladies working there are great and so nice. I haven't tried any of the sandwiches but that will be my next review.
author: Nana R.

description:
I grew up in this neighborhood, and even though I don't frequent Jim Georgie's, it's been one of the few establishments on San Bruno Avenue that has remained constant over the years.  Just seeing it from a distance takes me back to when I was a kid, when my mom would surprise me with a donut from there when she came home from work, or sometimes while walking down the street towards Walgreens, we would make a surprise turn into Jim Georgie's.  I was so proud to be tall enough to reach the counter and point to which donut I wanted.  TOP NOTCH FOR ALWAYS DISPLAYING DONUTS IN THE WINDOW - LOVE IT.  When I was old enough to walk around and spend money on my own, I'd get a small bag of fries to munch as I walked home.  I think I went to high school with the daughter of the family that runs it now.

To this day, if ever I am walking past that window, I can't help but look at the donuts and briefly flash back to my childhood.  I like the nostalgia that it brings to the neighborhood, and hope it stays around for other kids to grow up with it too.
author: Connie M.

description: My friendly neighborhood donut and coffee shop.  You can't go wrong with buying anything from here.  Ok, I know that's hard to believe by just looking from the outside because it is a little dingy but I promise the food will turn you blind to such frivolous things.  Items that NEVER fail me from Georgies is their donut holes, chocolate donut, and their egg and ham sandwich.  Did I mention that these were staples of my diet during my first pregnancy?  Everything is fresh, fresh, fresh.  I just wish they didn't close so early which keeps me from getting my donut fix after long stressful days of work.
author: Ivy Z.

description: I love this place!!! I have been coming to this spot for almost my whole life!!! They are always on top of their game and they always make the right burgers!!!!
author: Karen S.

description:
This is the American Breakfast/Lunch place to go near San Bruno Ave.

They've got your typical American breakfast menu and lots of donuts. If you don't like breakfast food, they've also got a huge selection of burgers, sandwiches, and other great lunch foods. 

Food is great and the people working there are really nice people.
author: Danny K.

description:
I have to admit, walking by this place gave me the creeps.  It's just the type of restaurant you pass and ask yourself, "How in the name of god is a place that looks like it must offer up food-born illness with every meal still be open?"

And in spite of all this, on a whim, I went in for a donut.  And let me tell you, it was pretty, pretty good.  I haven't had any of the other menu items here (spanning at least three continents with everything from chicken teriyaki, to burgers, to italian?), but I can vouch for the donuts.

Certainly not the kind of place to go out of your way to eat at, but if you're in the hood, and craving a donut, you won't go wrong here.
author: Laura K.

description:
Food here is pretty good.  I usually just grab some donuts and coffee and head out tho.  I remember eating here during my junior high days.  I used to always order a burger and fries to go.

I really like the ladies working there.  They treat me nice.
author: Gilbert C.

description:
This Chinese food/Doughnut shop is right across the street from my work, and let me tell you, the only things I would get from this store are coffee and a grilled cheese. 
The exterior is super scary, something out of a horror film, and the interior makes you feel like you'll get food poisoned by just breathing the air.
But the grilled cheese on wheat is surprisingly good, thought that is all that is good. So if you ever feel like a good grilled cheese, this is the place to go.
author: Rory V.

description:
These donuts are seriously delicious. I almost wished I would have had dessert first and cruised through here before having a yummy bowl of Pho at Cali Pho Nia just down the street.  

A donut from a local donut shop cannot be beat, nor can it be imitated. I wasn't at all surpised to learn this place has been around since mid-20th century.  Tasted and felt like a comfortable mainstay. 

Good cup of coffee, too.  Clean, unclumpy brown sugar on the counter.

I wish I lived in the neighborhood, because I'd have many more than just the handful of glazed donut holes I had today.
author: Julie K.

description:
Gotta love the mom-and-pop feel of this little donut shop.

Don't be fooled by the name, this place serves everything from pastrami sandwiches to fried chicken. Everything is fairly priced and the people are great! The main lady that works there reminds me of my mom. Can't say if that's a good thing or not, but go figure.

Support your local businesses!
author: Tu V.

description:
I think I kind of grew up eating J. Georgie's dough nuts! After 5pm their dough nuts are 3 for $1.20, it used to be only a $1 but I guess it is pretty worth it.  Their mini cheese burgers are good! I love their glazed dough nut. Their crumb dough nut is pretty good also.

They have raised their prices!! Now a dough nut costs 75cents for one!! It used to be .60cents. I would still buy my dough nuts here! I rather suppose Jim Georgie's then Safe Way!
author: Janet Z.

description:
A native of SF, and born and raised in the Portola District, I have been eating at this place for years.  

I recently re-discovered the joy of their burgers and fries.  Cheap, yummy, good...clean...it's awesome.

They also make breakfasts...and did I mention the donuts??  (Insert Homer Simpson gurgle here...)

so good.  go in and get a burger.  :)
author: diana p.

description:
three words: Mini Cheese Burger.

My ultimate comfort food. It's bigger than it sounds and it tastes better than any other burger joint around. It's just enough to satisfy my meat craving. But if you're looking to eat to the point of sleepiness, have the fries with it. The fries are always big and crunchy fresh.

It's a small neighborhood, locally owned place. So if you're a regular, the family that owns Jim Georgie's know your face and you're usual order.

The only issue I have with this place is that it's never opened late. However, they are opened at 6:30am and make breakfast too.
author: Maribel A.

description: words cannot explain how great this little restaurant is. One bite of the double cheeseburger oozes out awesomeness and gulping it down with water wont do it justice. I have lived in southern california for 3 years now, and I still couldn't find a burger shack as sexy as this. Oh yeah and the donuts are bomb too....
author: Darrell C.

description: This place is definitely one of Portola's hidden secrets. The prices are great and the food is excellent. I usually go for the Double Cheese Burger and Fries and I can walk out full without major damage to the wallet. The donuts are great also! I love the jelly filled donuts and the donut holes! Most of the donuts are usually gone by the end of the day and they'll even offer you a discount towards closing time. The people working there are super nice and tend to your needs quickly! Overall, it's a great place to go.
author: Jacky P.

description: I've been eating breakfasts and donuts here for over 20 years and it's still good!! I always have a bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich with everything. Eddie and his wife work the counter and Sonja is the cook. If you're nice to her, shell take your order while your still in line(or maybe that's just me!). Anyways, good basic breakfast at a very decent price Is what J. Georgies is all about.
author: Norm N.

description: I have been going here for over 40 years.  When a cheeseburger(bigger then the original Jumbo Jack), big bag of fries and a chocolate shake were $2.  It's changed hands and looks a few time but the food is always good.  I loved them then and now.   Food is reasonably priced and service is always good.  A nice little coffee shop with great employees.
author: Tonia R.

description: ive been coming to this place for donuts ever since i was like 4? they have thebest donuts ever!!
author: Allie Y.

description: We have lived in the neighborhood for over 11 years, and one thing is for sure, we love the donuts at Georgies! Yum! We have not had anything but the donuts. My hubby stops by every Friday morning to get an apple fritter, absolute perfection! We love the donut holes, but all of their donuts are awesome. The only reason for 4 stars is they always run out of the white frosting donuts with sprinkles. Those are my favorites.They should make more!
author: Keri V.

description: great place!!!!,u get more than your moneys worth!!,and its delicious and cheap.what more can u say
author: paul h.

description: This is my go-to place for donuts back at home. I only get donuts here. Not the mini-sized overly sweet krispy creme kind. Not the frilly, experimental  gourmet kind. (Well, one time I had a chocolate old-fashioned that tasted like bacon. Gourmet? Not sure. I don't think they meant for that to happen. It must have been the oil. Anyway. It was still good!) These people mean business. The donuts are great and are a welcome treat for my coworkers who have to sling books with me on Sunday shifts They go great with coffee and a  newspaper!
author: Patricia M.

description: I went here recently and the burgers and fries are still the same as when I was a kid. Even though the owner has changed, I'm glad the food is still the same.
author: Althea D.

description: Donuts are good over here, get some for your breakfast with your coffee before you go to work if you are in the area.
author: Jason C.

description: Have a friend who works there..she hooks it up!! Donuts are damn good (also approved by my fam when she drops a box over in the South Bay), and the burgers and fries aren't that bad! If my friend doesn't work here...I'd give it 4 stars..but as you can see I gave it 5!
author: Trish G.

description: Nice burgers. Needless to say, I didn't bring enough cash for more. Shame on me, only had about 5 dollars for burgers. On the brighter side, they came with fries. But then again, you have to buy your own soda. Very nice women working there too. I want to try their donuts and chili fries one day.. one day..
author: Danielle Y.

description: i believe it's a family business and it's been here since forever long! i like their donuts and so are their american breakfast/lunch so delicious. altho seating wise is very limited, most likely you might have to share tables with some strangers, unless theres not that much people. i think it's cash only and they open up early morning for people in the neighborhood that feeds for caffeines.
author: Valerie N.

description: my boyfriend took me here, and it looks kinda sketch. but its hella good! its cheap and tasty. i get the turkey burger and its always good..donut holes are also good. the people are nice and most morning you can catch the oldies chatting it up. all in all its cheap its tasty
author: Sandi V.
